intro: Heliotropium rosmarinifolium, commonly known as sweetroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its root system is tuberous, giving it the common name "sweetroot," and it is often used in traditional medicine. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
